item.title: End Taxpayer Funded Cell Phones Act of 2015

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Communications and Technology.

item.title: Ending Mobile and Broadband Welfare Act of 2015

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation.

item.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation.

summary.text:
Ending Mobile Phone Welfare Act of 2015

Prohibits a provider of commercial mobile communications service from receiving universal service support under specified provisions of the Communications Act of 1934 for the provision of such service through the Federal Communications Commission's Lifeline program that provides discounts on monthly telephone service to qualifying low-income consumers.

bill.title: Ending Mobile Phone Welfare Act of 2015

item.title: Ending Mobile Phone Welfare Act of 2015
A bill to prohibit universal service support of commercial mobile service through the Lifeline program.
Ending Mobile Phone Welfare Act of 2015

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
